data.title: Good for over 30 years
data.text: The server, Mike had waited on us 30 years before. The food is still as good as it was then. I had the Veal Parmesan, which comes with a small side of spaghetti and marinara. I ordered a side of spinach, which was just okay. The veal was very tender. The house wines are good and there is a large selection. Presently, there are traffic hassles, since Barksdale Blvd consists of dirt and construction equipment.

data.title: Nice Upscale Lunch view
data.text: Went with a group for a farewell visit.  Our waiter (Chris, I think) was friendly and on top of things.  The lunch was tasty and well portioned.  It was not too busy.

data.title: Quick in and out
data.text: My wife and I are in town for the River Cities Triathlon and I needed my pre-race lasagna. We saw this place on TA so decided to check it out. We were drastically underdressed and did not have a reservation but they got us worked in quickly! Service and food were great! Highly recommend.

data.title: Great quaint little local place with excellent food
data.text: Food was the best, freshest Italian we have to eat in this area... Service is always excellent, nice wine list. Awesome date night ....

data.title: Outstanding Italian Restaurant
data.text: If you like Italian food you must visit this place.  It looks like a little hole in the wall, but let me say some of the most wonderful food you will eat.

data.title: Delicious
data.text: We were there for supper. Between us we had the lasagna and spaghetti and meatballs. The red sauce is really good.  The bread us scrumptious and the creamy Italian dressing is Devine. We will definitely return.

data.title: Real Italian Cooking and atmosphere
data.text: We were very delighted to find this restaurant by happenstance.  We were staying about two blocks away and were looking for an Italian restaurant and did we hit the jackpot.  The meal was excellent and all sauces were prepared on site by the chef, so no fast food, chain meal. Chris, our waiter, was very attentive and experienced.  It happened to be our wedding anniversary (48th), and we were out of town on a road trip from San Antonio to home, so this delicious meal and very pleasant dining experience made the experience even more special and enjoyable.

data.title: Molto Bene - Very Good
data.text: The restaurant is now moving to the next generation, and they are doing well. It hasn't changed much in 30 years.  Quaint, comfortable surroundings with nice art.  Food is outstanding, and the wine list is very good.  The price is very fair.  We eat here at least 3x a month because it is true southern Italian food.

data.title: However You Say It, L'Italiano is Fantastic
data.text:
L’Italiano is a northwest Louisiana treasure. Even though most people can’t pronounce its name correctly (some just stop trying and inexplicably call it “Little Italy’), the food and atmosphere speak for themselves. There’s a reason this great Little Italian Restaurant has thrived in a relatively obscure setting. You don’t just happen upon this place; you must make a conscious decision to go there, and people have bene doing it for a long time.
Our most recent experience affirmed our well-established impression of L’Italiano.   We were there to celebrate a relative’s 70th birthday. It was his first time at the restaurant, and he couldn’t have been more pleased. We can say the same for ourselves. We started with Mozzarella E Pomodoro.  The tomatoes were good enough. They probably were not garden-fresh, and this time of year that would have been a real plus; but the key to this salad is the cheese-pesto combination.  The mozzarella had a nice texture and the pesto was slightly bold. The overall effect was very pleasing.
The diner special this evening was tenderloin with a green peppercorn sauce and sautéed spinach. The dish and presentation were first-rate, a real treat. Coincidentally two of the three diners ordered Salsiccia Abruzzese as an entrée. The sausage was spicy without being overbearing while the pasta and sauce were a perfect compliment to the sausage, onions and peppers.  
For dessert, we shared the cannoli, which was light a pleasing.
L’Italiano is a small restaurant, but that’s part of its charm. The servers have the opportunity to give diners the appropriate amount of attention, and they do it well. Our waiter was engaging and attentive. We were never left wanting for bread or beverage and yet he was not at all obtrusive. He pulled off that delicate balancing act quite well.
This restaurant consistently produces a quality dining experience. It’s definitely worth poking around the streets of “old Bossier” to find it.

data.title: A Nice Local Restaurant
data.text:
Found this place through Yelp!  Good, honest food.  The family running this restaurant is related to the family at Chianti - I tried them both and they are both on my list of places to hit next time in town.
   The walls are covered with names, initials, graffiti - when I took my glasses off it was a little bit lit living in a Jackson Pollock painting.
   Portions are a little on the small size, and prices are commensurate - that is good for me.

data.title: Authentic Italian!
data.text: Just left after eating lunch. My husband said it was the best Shrimp Alfredo he had ever eaten. My veal parmigian was delicious.  Everyone there was so friendly and the waiter was great and attentive. Found this place on Trip Advisor and definitely be back. I'm picky by the way!

data.title: Love Chicken Parmesan
data.text: So this restaurant is one of my favorite restaurants in Bossier City. I absolutely love the chicken parmesan. It's a small restaurant and the walls display the area's history. Every whose who has signed their name and left a message. Great lunch and dinner spot. Right across the street is Flying Heart Brewing and the Bossier Arts Council.

data.title: Great Atmosphere
data.text: Dined here with my daughter. Made reservations and were seated very quickly. Very friendly and attentive server. Food was fantastic. We will definitely dine here again.

data.title: Great red sauce
data.text: We order appetizers from The Flying Heart Brewery across the street. The crab claws were nice and loaded with garlic. The fried mushrooms had good flavor and texture. We enjoyed the red sauce brought for dipping.

data.title: Best veal around!
data.text: Small dining area with fantastic selection of Italian entrees. The veal is the best I've had.  Great service.

data.title: Nice little Italian place
data.text: Not too fancy but just right. Very friendly service, reasonable prices and really good food. I had a breaded chicken breast with a lemon sauce and it was fantastic. It comes with a side of pasta which was simple but very nice. I can't wait to go back and get the full dinner( app, salad, entree and dessert). The owner and the staff are first class.

data.title: Molte Grazie L'Italiano
data.text:
We had lunch here and it was just perfect!  The ambiance is very nice, homey Italian, the service is outstanding, and the food impeccable.  

I had Linguini Pescatore and there was an abundance of shellfish with a light and flavorful tomato sauce.  My wife had a Caesar salad with grilled chicken and it was delicious as well.  

My only regret is that we won't stay long enough to try them for dinner. This is a definite must try!

data.title: New favorite romantic date site
data.text: We had the appetizer with cheese prosciutto and salami, and both ordered spicy pasta dishes, mine with meatballs and his with shrimp. Both were fantastic. Our server was friendly and attentive and the atmosphere was romantic. Loved it.

data.title: Italian Restaurant full of character and very good food
data.text:
My wife and I changed our plans on Friday evening and rather than go for our usual Mexican we thought we'd give this place a try and were pleasantly surprised. The décor and ambience of the restaurant is old fashioned, traditional and romantic.  We were attended to, by the wait staff, quickly and efficiently.  I ordered the Piatto Freddo as an appetizer whilst we pondered on our entrees. The Piatto Freddo came quickly and was easily enough for the two of us to share with a good selection of fresh cheeses, olives and cured meats, I could have just eaten this with the fresh bread and a glass of wine but was looking forward to my entrée.

I eventually decided on the Pollo Paridisio, grilled chicken breast with sautéed crawfish tails in a white wine, cream and creole mustard sauce topped with mushrooms, and a side of steamed broccoli.  My wife, who didn't want a large entrée after the appetizer, chose a bowl of Minestrone soup and the Mozzarella E Pomodoro (fresh tomatoes and mozzarella).  

Our food was prepared and served to us in a very reasonable amount of time.  My chicken breast was succulent and delicious, the sauce was outstanding and a perfect consistency and the broccoli was cooked perfectly.  My wife's soup and mozzarella was also very fresh and delicious.

Although tempted with desert we chose not too since we had eaten enough, so rounded off the meal with coffee.  Total bill, food, glass of wine, beer and 2 coffees was less than $80, outstanding value for this class of restaurant.

Thank you, L'Italiano Restaurant, we will return.

data.title: Old fashioned romantic italian!!!!!
data.text:
A favorite of locals and tourists!!! The walls are inscribed with name after name of customers thru the years signing on the walls....adding to the intimate atmosphere. The food is terrific.....traditional and flavour filled. Wonderful fresh safood dishes and lasagna
That cant be beat!!!!!
